conclusion: On a heavily foggy day, a car was traveling at a speed of 30 m/s on the highway when it suddenly noticed a large truck traveling in the same direction at a constant speed of 10 m/s, 30 meters ahead.
The car applied emergency brakes, but the brakes failed during the braking process.
As shown in the diagram, a and b represent the v-t graphs of the car and the truck, respectively.
The v-t graph shows the car's speed decreases from 30 m/s to 10 m/s.
The truck maintains a constant speed of 10 m/s.

premise: The area under the curve of the car's v-t graph represents the distance traveled by the car.
conclusion: The distance traveled by the car is 30 meters.

premise: The truck is already 30 meters ahead and maintains a constant speed.
conclusion: The car will not be able to catch up to the truck and they will not collide.
